snippet: In an interview, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky offered a mix of contrition and defiance, saying that he was being held to an unfair standard.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul of Kentucky addresses claims of plagiarism with mix of contrition and defiance, acknowledging that 'mistakes' in his office led to unattributed writing by others to appear in his own work but adding that he is being held to an unfair standard.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: In an interview, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky offered a mix of contrition and defiance, saying that he was being held to an unfair standard.

headline.main: Though Defiant, Senator Accused of Plagiarism Admits Errors
headline.print_headline: Though Defiant, Senator Accused of Plagiarism Admits Errors
